name: textile production, silk | textile, silk | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21065/documentation

Inventory refers to 1kg woven silk fabric;This dataset covers all relevant input and output flows of the gate to gate unit process with a good overall data quality. The inventory is based on individual industry data and is an aggregate of weaving unit manufacturing various weights of fabric ranging from fine to heavy quality. ;This dataset represents the process of weaving 1 kg of silk textile.  The process consists of warping (preparing a sheet of lenghhwise, laid out set of warp yarns. There is no sizing involved. The weft yarn is then interlaced through the warp yarns to form a fabric. The woven cloth is rolled on a cloth beam as it is being woven. 

Activity starts with reception of silk yarn for warping


This activity ends production of with 1 kg silk textile as the final product of the weaving process. Machinery is excluded.
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1312:Weaving of textiles

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Based on average annual data from Indian manufacturer located in Bhagalpur (Bihar) in North India.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Handllom industry. Since this dataset reflects a handloom process, there are no machinery modelled
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Representative fom reeling centre were interviewed to provide data and suplimented with data from literature.
